subject: RE: [junit] RMI Classloading bug in TestCaseClassloader?
msgSnippet: Yep, same root problem (different symptom) as when you use JAXP classes under the same conditions: the JUnit ClassLoader doesn t always delegate to the parent

Yep, same root problem (different symptom) as when you use JAXP classes
under the same conditions: the JUnit ClassLoader doesn't always delegate to
the parent when it should.  Jini classes are slipping through the
excluded.properties.  Add net.jini.* to excluded.properties in the junit.jar
and try again.

Scott Stirling
Macromedia

-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Morris
To: JUnit List
Sent: 10/30/01 4:05 AM
Subject: [junit] RMI Classloading bug in TestCaseClassloader?

This looks like a bug to me:

My TestCase class is testing a class that uses RMI to get some remote
objects
(from a Jini lookup service, if you're interested/care).

The tests run clean when
    -- I use the Swing TestRunner with *-noloading*,
          [] specified on the cmd-line, or
          [] loading=false in junit.properties, or
          [] by switching it off in the GUI before running the test
    -- when I use the text TestRunner,
but *fails* by getting unexpected exceptions (listed below) when I use
the swing
TestRunner *with reloading*.

At this stage the testcase simply tests that the testee starts up Jini
service
discovery correctly and discovers some services in the network on the
theory
that there is no point in testing anything more if the rest of the
network is
not available.

I have checked FAQs, and spent the best part of a morning trying to come
up with
test cases that would replicate this bug, but confess that I'm stuck.
(Also
tried searching the list archives, but it seems that yahoo's server died
halfway
through my attempts.)  Does anyone have experience of something similar
in other
RMI-using situations?  Or better yet, suggestions as to how I can put
together a
test case to expose this!

----Exceptions: (This is one of several identical cases)

java.lang.ClassCastException: Assigning instance of class
net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceID to field
com.sun.jini.reggie.RegistrarProxy#serviceID
	at
java.io.ObjectInputStream.inputClassFields(ObjectInputStream.java:2270)
	at
java.io.ObjectInputStream.defaultReadObject(ObjectInputStream.java:519)
	at
java.io.ObjectInputStream.inputObject(ObjectInputStream.java:1411)
	at
java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject(ObjectInputStream.java:386)
	at
java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject(ObjectInputStream.java:236)
	at java.rmi.MarshalledObject.get(MarshalledObject.java:138)
	at
net.jini.discovery.IncomingUnicastResponse.<init>(IncomingUnicastRespons
e.java:78)
	at
net.jini.discovery.LookupDiscovery$UnicastDiscoverer.run(LookupDiscovery
.java:322)
